content: Oh hey guys welcome to the craft I'm TM
Scotty as you know good to have you with me this is my first vid of the new year
and I haven't done a bit in a while just because I holidays kind of kicked my
butt I had a lot of crafting projects I was doing for gifts I was making all my
gifts this year so that kept me really busy and I got a bit of a chest
congestion so I don't wanna be doing videos and hack in the whole time I'm
trying to do a video so I have a lot of backlog so give me some really cool
videos coming out but this will be the first one the new year and it's pretty
cool it's another variation of the tea light breezier super easy variation so
let's go to the table I'll show you how I did that
so with this version of the tea light braised here I want to make it a bit
different I've sanded the tea light to make it to make things that here to it
easier and you'll see why I did that just a light scuffing with the sandpaper
and I'm going to use this woodsy it's a shape you can get to the craft store and
I'm gonna put it I'm gonna mount it on top so this will be like a pestle with a
brazier on top of it okay so now what I'm gonna do is I need to I want to do
some detail on the flame like I did on the previous one but I've got to be
careful because there's only a limited amount of room in there and so if I
start messing with the base that much I'm gonna this thing won't fit flush so
what I'm gonna do is I'm going to take my glue gun
and I'm gonna put some texture on it but I'm going to try to keep away from the
base okay so let's let's still give it some texture without making it too wide
on the bottom so that the other piece won't fit so I'll finish this up and
then we'll move on to the next step so here I've done my sponge technique
and you can see that it really look makes that tea light look like stone and
that was the reason I use I scuffed it up a bit with the sandpaper so that
paint would stick better to the base I also you can also see that I've washed
the flame with a light yellow wash just to give it a nice coloring and now we
move on to the next step so again for this project I'm going to
use these sticks and these are just stitching you at the craft store and I
like them because they're kind of tapered and pointed okay
so I want to attach these to this wooden piece what I'm going to do is use my
scissors and I've measured a half inch piece and I'm just going to cut it so
what I'm going to do is I'm going to put four of these along the edge of this
okay so I'm going to go ahead and cut those and then I'm going to glue them on
and I'm not going to use the hot glue I'm actually going to use a little bit
of wit glue for a nice strong bond so I'll go ahead and do that and come back
here is the brazier itself with the spike supplied and I just use the tips
of those pieces of wood and cut the ends off and glued them on with the wood glue
and it gives a nice appearance of that and what I'll do is I'll paint it flat
black and then paint it up with some metallics
so here in this picture I can say I finished painting the brazier it's a bit
dark I painted it with a gunmetal and then I
did some highlights with a with a silver so that picks out some of those
highlights so now we'll go to the table and show you what it looks like in play
so here we have our braise ERT light setup on a tower tile and you can see
that looks really nice there you can see that it the pedestal blends in to the to
the texture paint there and then you have the brace your sitting on top of it
so it's like it looks like the brazier is actually sitting on top of a pedestal
and you can still take that off I didn't glue that down so you can change it out
if you want it and you can see the nice texture on the light there and then you
just put that on and then you're going to go so you have your eraser all set up
so there we go another alternative way to do a tea light breezier it's not
quite as big but still gives a really nice effect and there you go and I'll
see you next time on the craft hey you yeah you back here huh I know it was
short but woody expect you're the short Tim watch longer episodes if you want
Jesus quit bugging me hey and make sure you join the forum too
much for that oh yeah and have a magical craft astok day
